newsitem.title: FRANCE: Dassault Systemes shares extend gains.
newsitem.headline: Dassault Systemes shares extend gains.

text.p: Dassault Systemes shares were up sharply on the Paris bourse by mid-afternoon on Tuesday, building on Monday's gains.
The share was bolstered by a rally in technology shares overnight on the U.S. stock market Nasdaq, dealers said.
By 1328 GMT, the shares were 4.55 percent higher at 371.0 francs in volume of 29,692 shares after rising 5.89 percent on Monday.
Also lending support was an article on Tuesday in the French business daily La Tribune, dealers said.
The article suggested a planned merger between Dassault Aviation and Aerospatiale could lead the Airbus consortium, which includes Aerospatiale, to adopt Dassault Systemes' Catia software.
Airbus currently uses CFAO software made by Computervision of the United States while Boeing uses Catia.
